channel.title: [PI]NPC drops file isn't working?
channel.description:
I have figured out how to do everything else for this server and this even looks simple itself. The problem is that I edit the file but the npc doesn't drop the item on 100% or any. Then the second problem is that there are 2 files, NPCDrops.cfg and NPCDrops.tsm. When I couldn't figure it out after continuously testing I came here. It's almost like it's not even getting it's information of what the npc drops from either of them..but I've searched the entire thing. Please help.
NPCDrops.cfg [code]1 995 9 995 1624 3140 1249 1247 561 995 [/code]
NPCDrops.tsm [code]#Man drops 1:1 995:100 554:100 #Guard drops 9:1 995:200 555:100 #general graardor 2550:40 829:1 391:2 385:2 564:50 [/code]
This is the original code, the only edit I did was when I was testing was with the Man. Also, even though you can see that in the code the Man is supposed to drop some items, he never does after death. It's always bones only. I searched for a guide before I came here and it said to edit the .tsm file, though, as I did that did not work.

item.title: [PI]NPC drops file isn't working?
item.dc:creator: @Resent Resent
item.description:
@Resent wrote:

NPC drops for PI are located in config.java if you were still looking.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]NPC drops file isn't working?
item.dc:creator: @Scrotty Scrotty
item.description:
@Scrotty wrote:

Thank you for your reply Skiire, Though, I have fixed the error. Testing the drops now. I will try and look around for this method which controls npc bone drops at some point, that sounds like it could be interesting to discover and if necessary…to edit.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]NPC drops file isn't working?
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

It’s been a long time since I looked at PI so this is going to be a very vague description.

You said: “I don’t even think that since the beginning the man wasn’t dropping anything except bones.” I’ve seen a lot of ways drops are handled within PI… I’ve seen a method that handled bone drops for most NPC’s. You’re going to have to figure out how your server handles items. Check out your NPCHandler class and more specifically the dropItems method.

P.S. I can vouch for the validity of Teamviewer, it’s a quite common tool and I would trust it, however use your better judgment when it comes to who you let have your information.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ston3 wrote:

item.title: [PI]NPC drops file isn't working?
item.dc:creator: @Scrotty Scrotty
item.description:
@Scrotty wrote:

I meant no offense to you ston3. I’ve never heard of this “teamviewer” but I searched for it and after reading a basic description…I’m a bit too paranoid. What about just uploading a file or something? It’s Project Insanity so it’s source code is very well known to a lot of people.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]NPC drops file isn't working?
item.dc:creator: @ston3 ston3
item.description:
@ston3 wrote:

NPC ID: Drop Rate (how many kills it takes for a rare drop to drop)
The top line of the drops are common drops, and the bottom line is rare drop.

Excuse me for trying to narrow it down to my best of abilities, I just tried to help

I can maybe try to help you through teamviewer, if you would like, pm me teamviewer info

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]NPC drops file isn't working?
item.dc:creator: @Scrotty Scrotty
item.description:
@Scrotty wrote:

Unfortunately no, I don’t even think that since the beginning the man wasn’t dropping anything except bones. Though, you don’t need to spell it out for me, as I’ve said, I already knew everything else on how to code the server(tabbing included of course…). Thank you for confirming that the .tsm is correct. If anyone could confirm your way of describing it. That’d be a better understanding.

NPC ID:Drop rate 1:1

Other than that, if anyone could please respond with a possible fix I’d be grateful. I’m not giving up, this is taking awhile to get possible fixes, I’m going back into testing.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]NPC drops file isn't working?
item.dc:creator: @ston3 ston3
item.description:
@ston3 wrote:

I had this few weeks back. IT was SO frustrating, the only way I fixed it is, I do a backup of my source before I edit any file that could possibly glitch up. So I copied all the NPC Drop files, and pasted them onto my good source, and it worked like a charm.

Yes, if you want to edit drops you use the .TSM file, but don’t forget, once you add a new item, you don’t press (SPACE), you press (TAB). From what I see, yours is not a TAB, it is about 3 TABS? Idk

example: let’s use your man file.

#Man drops 1:1(TAB)995:100(TAB)554:100(TAB)4151:100 #Guard drops 9:1(TAB)995:200(TAB)555:100 #general graardor 2550:40(TAB)829:1(TAB)391:2(TAB)385:2(TAB)564:50

With the tabs it should look something like: although i can’t press tab on here, im doing 3 spaces, to represent a tab. SO DONT GET CONFUSED. Also remember, the 1:1 at the begging is, 1 being the NPC code, and the :1 is being how many kills it takes to drop something constantly I believe. And the space between (1:1) and 995:100 should be MUCH greater than the space between (995:100) and (554:100) although it is still a tab, it separates it farther than the rest. So keep that in mind

#Man drops 1:1 995:100 554:100 4151:100 #Guard drops 9:1 995:200 555:100 #general graardor 2550:40 829:1 391:2 385:2 564:50

Hope I helped. Goodluck!

Read full topic
